newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: Czech SPT to launch bond issue by year-end.
newsitem.headline: Czech SPT to launch bond issue by year-end.

text.p: Czech telephone operator SPT Telecom a.s. on Tuesday said it would issue up to seven billion crowns worth of seven-year bonds by the end of the year.

"SPT...intends to issue bonds in the Czech capital markets of up to seven billion crowns and a maturity of seven years. The bonds will be lead managed by Ceska Sporitelna and it is foreseen to issue the paper at the year-end 1996," an SPT statement said.
"The issue will focus on the domestic investor, particularly the retail sector and will also be sold through branches of Sporitelna throughout the Czech Republic," it added.
It said funds from the issue will be used to help finance the firm's extensive network development programme.
